task.summary: Default task
Updated app entry point index.js to dispatch the loadCourses action into the store.

Extracted out JSX from CoursesPage to create a CourseList to add in it. Also created CourseListRow to manage each of them separately. Added in CoursesPage the reference to them and destructed the object we pass in.
Adding course category
Created a file template to make React container components directly. New ManageCoursePage to see their info. Added a route to the course management page and other to edit it.
Created a CourseForm which references two child components TextInput and SelectInput to host course data.
Created TextInput and SelectInput to host our JSX and logic to edit courses.
Updated ManageCoursePage to display edit course form ;=)
Created a thunk to relate actions and dispatch in an asynchronous call in authorActions

Created an authorReducer to get the state and fire the action poperly. Created an initialState to host in a constants file all initial states. Changed rootReducer aka reducers/index.js to execute our author one. Making in our entry index.js point a call from the store to get all authors.
Trying to map author data for the dropdown but browser says there is a bad import.
Added missing extension.js to authorActions!
Added missing extension.js to authorActions!
Added a handler to type in Manage Course form fields.
Created a new thunk to saveCourse, created the actioncreator and the actionType ;=)
Added two cases to our courseReducer to manage creation and updating them
Fixing bug creating a course doesn't display its info just and empty row. Fixing browser complaining about having a table with a tr as a top level child.
Adding a redirect after creating the course to courseList. Using react router context for first time ;=).
Adding form population when clicking on an existing course. TO DO: Make form being populated when hitting refresh page.
Fixed populating form when refreshing page.
Adding a way to tell user when an asynchronous call is in progress.
Adding an actioncreator an actiontype and a variable to track ajax calls
Created our ajaxBeginCall reducer and linked it into the root reducer.
Dispatched beginAjaxCall in our course and author actions
Implemented logic to put in use our preloader when there are ajax calls in progress, connecting our react and redux components in our entry point app.js
Added logic to wait after saving a course for the mock API call being successful before displaying the redirect to course list.
Added logic to disable saving button when processing is ongoing. Also fixed typo in CourseForm renaming loading to saving.
Adding toastr to pop up a green window after saving a course.
Added error handling to display a red pop up when course validation fails and updated internal redux store to display preloader just enough time to let user know processing is tried.

Using mocha as test framework, expect as assert library and ReactTestUtils as test API.
Green: renders form
Green: renders form and h1
Green: save button is labeled "Save" when not saving ;=)
Green: save button is labeled "Saving..." when saving ;)
Green: renders form and h1
Green: save button is labeled "Save" when not saving
Green: save button is labeled "Saving..." when saving.
Green: Starting our test to test: Manage Course Page: sets error message when trying to save empty title

Green: Learning how to tweak passing in whatever is included in mapStateToProps using an export in ManageCoursePage.js and importing it with {} which means it is a named import of an unconnected component. Also learning how to face when there is an error about passing in mapDispatchToProps content, the solution is doing a no-op passing in a Promise.resolve()
Green: Manage Course Page, sets error message when trying to save empty title.
Green: Author Selectors, authorsFormattedForDropwdown, should return author data formatted for use in dropdown

Green: Course Actions, createCourseSuccess, should create a CREATE_COURSE_SUCCESS action
Testing an action creator for first time.

Green: Course Reducer, should add course when passed CREATE_COURSE_SUCCESS
Testing a reducer for first time ;=)
Green: Course Reducer, should add course when passed CREATE_COURSE_SUCCESS and titles be the ones posted
Green: Course Reducer, it('should update course when passed UPDATE_COURSE_SUCCESS'

Green: Course Actions, it('should create BEGIN_AJAX_CALL and LOAD_COURSES_SUCCESS when loading courses'
Testing a thunk (which is something which is used to load asynchrnous data and returns a function and is commonly related to dispatch an action).
Green: Store, Should handle creating courses ;=)
Separated our development and production stores to wipe out invariant from the second one to make the app faster.

Adapted our webpack config to use a GLOBAL variable from NODE_ENV to distinguis development and production modes. Also it makes our css file a separated physical file. Also we have written a build.js to point to our new webpack production mode config and message errors, warnings and output.
Created a script to point the new physical css file created when running the production build.
Created a script to read dist folder and open the browser after it loads.

MESSAGE.value: Added logic to wait after saving a course for the mock API call being successful before displaying the redirect to course list.
Added logic to disable saving button when processing is ongoing. Also fixed typo in CourseForm renaming loading to saving.
Adding toastr to pop up a green window after saving a course.
Added error handling to display a red pop up when course validation fails and updated internal redux store to display preloader just enough time to let user know processing is tried.

Separated our development and production stores to wipe out invariant from the second one to make the app faster.

Adapted our webpack config to use a GLOBAL variable from NODE_ENV to distinguis development and production modes. Also it makes our css file a separated physical file. Also we have written a build.js to point to our new webpack production mode config and message errors, warnings and output.

Tweaked package.json to build and start our distribution.

option.name: LAST_COMMIT_MESSAGE
option.value: Tweaked package.json to build and start our distribution.
